column5: Welcome to OFC ReefRunner... nice pics  Look forward to following your posts...  If you are in need of fishing that badly, why not do some on Hard Water!  Just a thought  Cheers,  Jen
Welcome Reefrunner!   Sooo found out that you can post at work...now you are in trouble.....should I not mention the chat feature???  lol

You guys are gonna get me fired. lol.  The bright-side on that note, I'd be fishing more often...cause it'll have to be fish for dinner 7 nights a week. lol  Thanks a bunch guys and gals!  Look forward to contributing.  reefrunner
Welcome!!
welcome to the board!  And your wearing the right hat thats for sure!  Cheers!

Hi all,  New to the board and would like to start by saying you have an absolutley great resource here and  an even better group of members.  My name's Mike and I'm a fishaholic.  I'm facing some serious withdrawal here and can't wait until May spring opener; at that, I'm likely not alone, lol.  I've been on the rod and reel since I can remember.  My most targeted species are of the essox family. Currently, I live in Mississauga but work in Toronto in IP law.  When May opener swings around you can find me chuckin' spinner baits in the Kawartha's. Further into the season I'm chasin' some G-Bay giants in June and bushwackin' into some back-lake bassin'.  Caught my first ever salmon during the run this fall and will be back for another.  Just bought myself a digital camera for Christmas so I can take pics of my tales out on the water.  Would like to upload a couple testers here but can't seem to get it working at the moment...link to a post on uploading pics?    I look forward to contributing to this wonderful community in the months and catches ahead.  Tight lines and best of luck to all in 2008.  reefrunner

Hi Reefrunner, Great introduction. Welcome to the board. As far as receiving help for your fishaholic condition-don't expect any here. Your problem may only get worse. Ok, sign up at www.photobucket.com. Once signed up, you log in. Upload pictures to photobucket. Now once it is uploaded, there are 3 codes for that picture right below. If you want to post it directly to the post on OFC, hilight the  tag/code then right click and finally go to your post and right click and paste. If you have more that one picture make sure you put the copied tag/code under each other. If you put the code side by side you will make a mess.
Good to have you here Mike.  Looking forward to some reports and pics in the future.  Cheers, ben
welcome and enjoy,look forward to your reports
Very nice intro.  You'll enjoy it here.  I'm in the same boat as you with posting pic's  Thanks for the tip Bernie  Cheers  Craig
Welcome aboard! Take yer shoes off, an stay awhile.

Geez.  Cruisin' around the community for no longer than ten minutes and already a helping hand.  Thank's a stringer-full Bernie.  Here it goes...wait for it.    A smallie I woke up in the middle of the night.    Sorry for the nudity.  Think it was July on the pontoon at the folks' cottage.    Little tiger caught last year, beautiful colours.  First 'ski I saw coming out of this particular Kawartha lake in ten years.  Hope she worked.  reefrunner

Welcome Mike. Sounds like you're going to be a great contributor and a valuable resource to this board. Glad you could make it. I'm looking forward to your reports and input (and like you,softwater again). By your "handle"  I'm taking it that reefrunners are one of your baits of choice?
Not bad.  Just gotta get 'em smaller.  Thanks all for the warm welcome in these cold months.  cheers,  reefrunner
Welcome aboard reefrunner, I'll be looking forward to your reports this year.  Enjoy
Welcome to the zoo Mike, you'll fit in well here....  Maureen

Pictures came through just fine here RR.  On the note on how to post pics. I copied and pasted that paragraph at the time I had asked the same question a year ago. I cant remember who authored it but it's possible douG did. There is a personal notepad in "My Controls" that I stored it to. Handy spot to keep stuff pertaining to here.
Welcome aboard, Mike.

Welcome aboard RR !!!!.  ..well it sounds like you eat,breath & sleep,fish !!! well then you will fit right in here just fine.LOL..LOL well remember the camera & take lots of pics & have fun,maybe ill see ya on the water !!!...cheers

Welcome to the board!  Great intro and some great pictures as well.  I can already tell you'll fit right in here!  Looking forward to your reports this coming season.  My wife  Bly and I have the fishing itch bad....cant wait for the spring run of the steelies up the tribs...until then, I look here for my fishing fix!
Well reefrunner ... you have taken that very first an most important step.   NO - not admitting your problem.  BUT - that you joined OFC.  Welcome aboard.

This place won't help your fishing addiction. It will make that worse, and in about a month you'll realize your addicted to the forum as well. I've quite fighting the fishing addiction, and i now look at the rest of the world as a "hobby", and fishing as "reel life" Pun intended.  Cya Around  -Ramble
Weclmoe a board Mike !  Ooops... wrong meeting.
Welcome to the board Mike looking forward to the Digital pics cause those analog pics look a little fuzzy and they make you look way to white man.  Looking forward to your reports
welcome to the board mike  rob
Welcome Mike, Enjoy the company...
great intro......welcome to the site man!

Welcome to the board Mike, what area of the Kawarthas do you normally fish?  Unlike some of the other support groups, we don't have weekly meetings.... oh no, we thake our adiction very seriously, we meet anytime, anywhere, and every chance we get.  Hope you can make it to the "fishing for Tyler" event in two weeks, it will give you a chance to meet up with a bunch of the locals and we always have good food, good fun, and it signals that spring is just around the corner.

Thanks everyone again.  I look forward to sharing my addiction with "like-minded" individuals.  MTP, Those pictures are from film prints as you can tell by the quality...but I am ghostly white. lol.  Big Cliff, I mainly fish on Canal Lake as my parents cottage is there.  Anyone lookin' for tips on that body of water I know like the back of my   I'm there pretty darn much every weekend in the summer.  I'm the dude castin away to CCR tracks in the weee hours, waking up the fishes, hope I didn't wake anyone. lol.  Venture out to Balsam now and again, but the operating times at the liftlock in Kirkfield doesn't provide me an opportunity to fish "peak" times, therefore, I haven't much luck but a couple of smallies and some big waves to surf in the pontoon.  Fishing for Tyler sounds like an amazing time and a great cause.  I'm nursing a broken pinky at the moment so the cold doesn't sound fun.  I'll try to get out and meet some of you folks.  If I cannot make it though I would like to make a contribution as it is a worthy cause.  Let me "hustle" someone I know for some ice gear and go from there.  Thanks again all,  reefrunner
Just found out I can post from work.  What did I get myself into?  I'm in for some BIG, BIG trouble. lol  Thanks OFC
